alert.note: Alert for Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 14 at 8:15PM AKDT until March 15 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Windy with blowing and drifting snow. Northeast winds gusting to 45 mph. Wind chills to 50 below. * WHERE...Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Areas of blowing snow could reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Large snow drifts will form. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 50 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...North winds gusting to 45 mph are occuring across the area, causing areas of blowing and drifting snow and cold wind chills. In Howard Pass, winds are gusting to 70 mph with wind chills to 70 below, but those conditions are confined to the Howard Pass area. Winds are expected to decrease during the day Wednesday.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas.
